programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Clemson held on to beat SMU, 57-54, to advance behind 21 points from Chase Hunter; Louisville won the lone season meeting with the Tigers, 74-64, on Jan. 7 behind 32 points and 10 rebounds from J'Vonne Hadley, along with a James Scott double-double.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Tennessee defeated Texas, 83-72, to advance behind 23 points from Chaz Lanier and 19 from Zakai Zeigler; Auburn won the lone regular-season meeting with the Volunteers, 53-51, on Jan. 25 behind 16 points and 14 rebounds from Johni Broome.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Florida/Missouri winner goes up against the Alabama/Kentucky winner for a berth in the SEC Tournament championship game; Auburn won the title last year, defeating Florida in the final, 86-67, behind 19 points from tournament MVP Johni Broome.

programme.desc: Houston/BYU winner goes up against the Texas Tech/Arizona winner in the Big 12 Tournament championship game for an automatic NCAA Tournament berth; Iowa State won the title last year, beating Houston in the final, 69-41, behind Keshon Gilbert.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma City claimed a 125-96 victory over Milwaukee in their first meeting of the season on Feb. 3 behind 34 points and 6 assists from Shai Gilgeous-Alexander; Ryan Rollins posted 16 points and an assist for the Bucks in the loss.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.desc: Expert analysts preview the upcoming action in the NBA, evaluating the strengths and weaknesses of each team while breaking down the pivotal matchups; coverage includes exclusive interviews, insightful commentary and special features.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: New York claimed wins over Miami in their first two meetings of the season, winning the most recent matchup on March 2 with a 116-112 score after overtime; Jalen Brunson posted 31 points ad 6 assists for the Knicks in 42 minutes played of the win.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Bryant won both regular-season meetings with Maine, including an 81-55 win on Jan. 4 behind 18 points from both Earl Timberlake and Barry Evans before an 80-72 victory on March 1 behind 28 points from Rafael Pinzon and 15 from Timberlake.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: North Texas/Tulsa winner goes up against the UAB/East Carolina winner for a berth in the AAC Tournament championship game; UAB won the title last year, defeating Temple in the final, 85-69, behind a double-double from MVP Yaxel Lendeborg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Miami (OH)/Kent State winner goes up against top-seeded Akron, which defeated Toledo, 100-90, in the semifinals to advance behind 31 points and six assists from Nate Johnson, along with 15 points from both Isaiah Gray and Tavari Johnson.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UC San Diego won both regular-season meetings with UC Santa Barbara, including an 84-76 win on Dec. 5 behind 22 points from Aniwaniwa Tait-Jones and 19 from Nordin Kapic before a 77-63 victory on Jan. 23 behind 25 points from Tait-Jones.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: South Carolina State/North Carolina Central winner goes up against top-seeded Norfolk State, which defeated Morgan State, 58-55, in the semifinals to advance behind a game-high 19 points from Christian Ings and 14 points from Brian Moore Jr.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: UC Irvine won both regular-season meetings with Cal Poly, including a 98-89 overtime win on Jan. 2 behind 25 points from Devin Tillis and 24 from Bent Leuchten before a 101-71 victory on Jan. 18 behind 21points and seven rebounds from Tillis.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arizona and Texas Tech split their two regular-season meetings, including a 70-54 Red Raiders win on Jan. 18 behind 20 points and 16 rebounds from JT Toppin before an 82-73 Wildcats victory on Feb. 8 behind 16 points and six assists from Caleb Love.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: The top knockouts in UFC history are showcased in full detail, including top brawlers scoring vicious strikes in championship bouts, rivals who want to leave their opponent cold on the ground, and newcomers testing their mettle against veterans.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Tulane beat Florida Atlantic, 83-76, to advance behind 20 points from Asher Woods; Memphis won the lone season meeting with the Green Wave, 68-56, on Jan. 30 behind 19 points and 10 rebounds from Dain Dainja, along with 14 points from Colby Rogers.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Renowned fishing champion Jimmy Houston travels around the world fishing for largemouth bass, crappie and other fish, and he demonstrates his hunting techniques with other athletes, celebrities and friends who love to fish.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1983, North Carolina State suffered 10 losses in the regular season and had to overcome national powerhouses to win the ACC Tournament and qualify for the NCAA Tournament, where the Wolfpack mounted a memorable run to the national championship.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Christian Laettner used his brash and boisterous personality mixed with his on-court skills to become one of the most despised college basketball athletes in the history of the sport, as the documentary focuses on why he garnered those sentiments.

programme.desc: Six-time MotoGP champion Marc Marquez opened the season with a dominant victory at Thailand to gain an early eight-point lead over his brother, Alex Marquez; Marco Bezzecchi won the last race at Argentina in 2023 over Johann Zarco.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: Christopher Bell made it three-straight wins following his victory at Phoenix over Denny Hamlin, while William Byron leads the points standings; Kyle Larson and Joey Logano won the two races at Las Vegas last year over Tyler Reddick and Bell.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: St. John's/Marquette winner goes up against the Creighton/UConn winner in the Big East Tournament championship game for an automatic NCAA Tournament berth; UConn won the title last year, defeating Marquette in the final, 73-57, behind Tristen Newton.

programme.title: Kevin Harvick's Happy Hour
programme.desc: Former NASCAR driver and 2014 Cup Series champion Kevin Harvick and his friends break down the latest news making headlines across NASCAR, going over the latest results and interview guests to gather their unique perspective on the sport.

programme.title: Destined to Drive: Patrick Dempsey's Return to Racing
MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Minnesota claimed victories over Kansas City in all three of their meetings from the 2024 season, winning the final matchup on Sept. 21 with a 2-0 scoreline; Kelvin Yeboah and Bongokuhle Hlongwane found the net from a pair of Robin Lod assists.

programme.desc: Exploring the growth of flag football around the United States and the world.

programme.desc: Inter Miami CF scored twice in the second half to defeat Jamaican side Cavalier S.C. at Chase Stadium in the first leg matchup, 2-0, on March 6, as Tadeo Allende scored in the 61st minute and Luis Surez added a goal in the 83rd minute.
